item.text: There was no war between Syria and Israel for three years.

<st data-num="01961 08141">In</st> the <st data-num="07992" class="">third</st> <st data-num="01961 08141">year</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="03092" class="">Jehoshaphat</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> <st data-num="03381" class="">came down</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> visit<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> his <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st>, “Surely you <st data-num="03045" class="">recognize</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> <st data-num="07433" class="">Ramoth</st> <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st> belongs to us, though <st data-num="0587" class="">we</st> are <st data-num="02814" class="">hesitant</st> to <st data-num="03947" class="">reclaim</st> it <st data-num="03027" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0758" class="">Syria</st>.”<n id="1" />

Then he <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03092" class="">Jehoshaphat</st>, “Will you <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> me to <st data-num="04421" class="">attack</st> <st data-num="07433" class="">Ramoth</st> <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st>?” <st data-num="03092" class="">Jehoshaphat</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, “I will <st data-num="03644" class="">support</st> <st data-num="03644" class="">you</st>; my <st data-num="05971" class="">army</st> and <st data-num="05483" class="">horses</st> are <st data-num="05971 05483">at your disposal</st>.”<n id="1" />
But then Jehoshaphat said to Israel’s king, “Please seek a message from the Lord this very day.”

So the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="06908" class="">assembled</st> about <st data-num="0702 03967 0376">400</st> <st data-num="05030" class="">prophets</st> and <st data-num="0559 0413">asked</st> them, “Should I <st data-num="01980 05921 04421">attack</st> <st data-num="07433" class="">Ramoth</st> <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st> <st data-num="0518" class="">or</st> <st data-num="02308" class="">not</st>?”<n id="1" /> They <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="05927" class="">Attack</st>! The <st data-num="0136" class="">Sovereign One</st><n id="2" /> will <st data-num="05414" class="">hand</st> it <st data-num="03027" class="">over</st> to the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>.”
But Jehoshaphat asked, “Is there not a prophet of the Lord still here, that we may ask him?”

The king of Israel answered Jehoshaphat, “There is still one man through whom we can seek the Lord’s will. But I despise him because he does not prophesy prosperity for me, but disaster. His name is Micaiah son of Imlah.” Jehoshaphat said, “The king should not say such things.”
The king of Israel summoned an official and said, “Quickly bring Micaiah son of Imlah.”

Now the king of Israel and King Jehoshaphat of Judah were sitting on their respective thrones, dressed in their robes, at the threshing floor at the entrance of the gate of Samaria. All the prophets were prophesying before them.
Zedekiah son of Kenaanah made iron horns and said, “This is what the Lord has said, ‘With these you will gore Syria until they are destroyed.’”
All the prophets were prophesying the same, saying, “Attack Ramoth Gilead! You will succeed; the Lord will hand it over to the king.”

Now the <st data-num="04397" class="">messenger</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> to <st data-num="07121" class="">summon</st> <st data-num="04321" class="">Micaiah</st> <st data-num="01696 0559">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him, “<st data-num="02009 04994">Look</st>, the <st data-num="01697 05030">prophets</st> are in <st data-num="0259" class="">complete</st> <st data-num="06310" class="">agreement</st> that the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> will <st data-num="02896 0413">succeed</st>.<n id="1" /> Your <st data-num="01697" class="">words</st> <st data-num="01961 04994">must</st> <st data-num="01697 0259">agree</st> with <st data-num="01992" class="">theirs</st>; you must <st data-num="01696" class="">predict</st> <st data-num="02896" class="">success</st>.”<n id="2" />
But Micaiah said, “As certainly as the Lord lives, I will say what the Lord tells me to say.”
When he came before the king, the king asked him, “Micaiah, should we attack Ramoth Gilead or not?” He answered him, “Attack! You will succeed; the Lord will hand it over to the king.”
The king said to him, “How many times must I make you solemnly promise in the name of the Lord to tell me only the truth?”
Micaiah said, “I saw all Israel scattered on the mountains like sheep that have no shepherd. Then the Lord said, ‘They have no master. They should go home in peace.’”

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03092" class="">Jehoshaphat</st>, “<st data-num="03808" class="">Didn’t</st> I <st data-num="0559 0413">tell</st> you he does <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05012" class="">prophesy</st> <st data-num="02896" class="">prosperity</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> me, <st data-num="03588 0518">but</st> <st data-num="07451" class="">disaster</st>?”
Micaiah said, “That being the case, listen to the Lord’s message. I saw the Lord sitting on his throne, with all the heavenly assembly standing beside him on his right and on his left.
The Lord said, ‘Who will deceive Ahab, so he will attack Ramoth Gilead and die there?’ One said this and another that.
Then a spirit stepped forward and stood before the Lord. He said, ‘I will deceive him.’
The Lord asked him, ‘How?’ He replied, ‘I will go out and be a lying spirit in the mouths of all his prophets.’ The Lord said, ‘Deceive and overpower him. Go out and do as you have proposed.’
So now, look, the Lord has placed a lying spirit in the mouths of all these prophets of yours, but the Lord has decreed disaster for you.”
Zedekiah son of Kenaanah approached, hit Micaiah on the jaw, and said, “Which way did the Lord’s Spirit go when he went from me to speak to you?”

<st data-num="04321" class="">Micaiah</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “<st data-num="02005" class="">Look</st>, you will <st data-num="07200" class="">see</st> in <st data-num="01931" class="">the</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">when</st> you <st data-num="0935" class="">go</st> into an <st data-num="02315" class="">inner</st> <st data-num="02315" class="">room</st> to <st data-num="02247" class="">hide</st>.”

Then the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="03947" class="">Take</st> <st data-num="04321" class="">Micaiah</st> and <st data-num="07725" class="">return</st> him <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="0526" class="">Amon</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> <st data-num="08269" class="">official</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">and</st> <st data-num="03101" class="">Joash</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>.

<st data-num="0559" class="">Say</st>, ‘<st data-num="03541" class="">This is what</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">says</st>, “<st data-num="07760" class="">Put</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this man</st> in <st data-num="01004 03608">prison</st>. <st data-num="0398" class="">Give</st> him only a <st data-num="03906" class="">little</st> <st data-num="03899" class="">bread</st> and <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> I <st data-num="07965" class="">safely</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">return</st>.”’”<n id="2" />
Micaiah said, “If you really do safely return, then the Lord has not spoken through me.” Then he added, “Take note, all you people.”
The king of Israel and King Jehoshaphat of Judah attacked Ramoth Gilead.

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03092" class="">Jehoshaphat</st>, “I will <st data-num="02664" class="">disguise</st> myself and then <st data-num="0935" class="">enter</st><n id="1" /> into the <st data-num="04421" class="">battle</st>, but <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> <st data-num="03847" class="">wear</st> your royal <st data-num="0899" class="">robes</st>.” So the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="02664" class="">disguised</st> himself and then <st data-num="0935" class="">entered</st> into the <st data-num="04421" class="">battle</st>.

Now the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0758" class="">Syria</st> had <st data-num="06680 0559">ordered</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">his</st> <st data-num="07970 08147" class="">32</st> <st data-num="07393" class="">chariot</st> <st data-num="08269" class="">commanders</st>, “Do <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03898 0854">fight</st> <st data-num="06996" class="">common soldiers</st> or <st data-num="01419" class="">high-ranking officers</st>;<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588 0518 0854">fight</st> <st data-num="0905" class="">only</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.”

<st data-num="01961" class="">When</st> the <st data-num="07393" class="">chariot</st> <st data-num="08269" class="">commanders</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> <st data-num="03092" class="">Jehoshaphat</st>, <st data-num="01992" class="">they</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="01931" class="">He</st> <st data-num="0389" class="">must</st> be the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.” So they <st data-num="05493 05921">turned</st> and <st data-num="03898" class="">attacked</st> him, but <st data-num="03092" class="">Jehoshaphat</st> <st data-num="02199" class="">cried out</st>.

<st data-num="01961" class="">When</st> the <st data-num="07393" class="">chariot</st> <st data-num="08269" class="">commanders</st> <st data-num="07200 03588">realized</st> <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> was <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, they <st data-num="07725" class="">turned away</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">from</st> him.

Now an <st data-num="0376" class="">archer</st> <st data-num="04900" class="">shot</st> an <st data-num="07198" class="">arrow</st> at <st data-num="08537" class="">random</st>,<n id="1" /> and it <st data-num="05221" class="">struck</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> the <st data-num="01694" class="">plates</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">of</st> his <st data-num="08302" class="">armor</st>. The king<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">ordered</st> his <st data-num="07395" class="">charioteer</st>, “<st data-num="02015" class="">Turn</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">around</st> and <st data-num="03318" class="">take</st> me <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="04264" class="">battle line</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> I’m <st data-num="02470" class="">wounded</st>.”

While the <st data-num="04421" class="">battle</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">raged</st> throughout <st data-num="01931" class="">the</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>, the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="01961 05975">stood propped up</st> in his <st data-num="04818" class="">chariot</st> <st data-num="05227" class="">opposite</st> the <st data-num="0758" class="">Syrians</st>. He <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st> in the <st data-num="06153" class="">evening</st>; the <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> from the <st data-num="04347" class="">wound</st> <st data-num="03332" class="">ran down</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="02436" class="">bottom</st> of the <st data-num="07393" class="">chariot</st>.

As the <st data-num="08121" class="">sun</st> was <st data-num="0935" class="">setting</st>, a <st data-num="07440" class="">cry</st> <st data-num="05674 0559">went</st> through the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st>, “<st data-num="0376" class="">Each one</st> should return <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> his <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">and</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> his <st data-num="0776" class="">homeland</st>.”

So the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st> and was <st data-num="0935" class="">taken</st> to <st data-num="08111" class="">Samaria</st>, where they <st data-num="06912" class="">buried</st> <st data-num="04428 08111">him</st>.<n id="1" />
They washed off the chariot at the pool of Samaria. Then the dogs licked his blood, while the prostitutes bathed, in keeping with the Lord’s message that he had spoken.

The rest of the events of Ahab’s reign, including a record of his accomplishments and how he built a luxurious palace and various cities, are recorded in the scroll called the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Ahab passed away. His son Ahaziah replaced him as king.
In the fourth year of Ahab’s reign over Israel, Asa’s son Jehoshaphat became king over Judah.

<st data-num="03092" class="">Jehoshaphat</st> was <st data-num="07970" class="">thirty</st>-<st data-num="02568" class="">five</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st> when he <st data-num="04427" class="">became king</st>, and he <st data-num="04427" class="">reigned</st> for <st data-num="06242 02568" class="">25</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>.<n id="1" /> His <st data-num="08034 0517">mother</st> was <st data-num="05806" class="">Azubah</st>, the <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st> of <st data-num="07977" class="">Shilhi</st>.

He followed in his father Asa’s footsteps and was careful to do what the Lord approved. (22:44) However, the high places were not eliminated; the people continued to offer sacrifices and burn incense on the high places.
(22:45) Jehoshaphat was also at peace with the king of Israel.
The rest of the events of Jehoshaphat’s reign, including his successes and military exploits, are recorded in the scroll called the Annals of the Kings of Judah.

He <st data-num="01197" class="">removed</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> <st data-num="03499" class="">any</st> <st data-num="06945" class="">male cultic prostitutes</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> had <st data-num="07604" class="">managed to survive</st> the <st data-num="03117" class="">reign</st> of his <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="0609" class="">Asa</st>.<n id="1" />

There was <st data-num="0369" class="">no</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> in <st data-num="0123" class="">Edom</st> at this time; a <st data-num="05324" class="">governor</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">ruled</st>.

<st data-num="03092" class="">Jehoshaphat</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">built</st> a fleet of <st data-num="08659" class="">large merchant</st> <st data-num="0591" class="">ships</st><n id="1" /> to <st data-num="01980" class="">travel</st> to <st data-num="0211" class="">Ophir</st> for <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>, but they <st data-num="03808" class="">never</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">made</st> the <st data-num="01980" class="">voyage</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> <st data-num="0591" class="">they</st> were <st data-num="07665" class="">shipwrecked</st> in <st data-num="06100" class="">Ezion Geber</st>.
Then Ahaziah son of Ahab said to Jehoshaphat, “Let my sailors join yours in the fleet,” but Jehoshaphat refused.
Jehoshaphat passed away and was buried with his ancestors in the city of his ancestor David. His son Jehoram replaced him as king.
In the seventeenth year of Jehoshaphat’s reign over Judah, Ahab’s son Ahaziah became king over Israel in Samaria. He ruled for two years over Israel.
He did evil in the sight of the Lord and followed in the footsteps of his father and mother; like Jeroboam son of Nebat, he encouraged Israel to sin.
He worshiped and bowed down to Baal, angering the Lord God of Israel just as his father had done.
